review: Bought it purely because of the 2GB RAM statistic, and that I was in the market for a digital TV content box.  However, there are some major issues I've discovered with my 9 months of using the device.Best Features:1. Speed: It works amazing on my internet connection with only a few glitches.2. Access to Amazon Content: I can access anything on Amazon available for purchase very easily.  The Prime tab is what I use most often where the featured Prime content is.  See Search issues below for more details on this topic.3. Inconspicuous: There's no goofy branding. Not on the device, not in a startup logo show, nothing.  Just opens right up to access content, directly from the home screen too--very little additional clicks, except with outside service providers (see Apps below).Problems:1. It doesn't sync/update well.2. Along with #1, Prime Music on Fire TV is TERRIBLE. Impossible to access or sift through, and does. not. update. Which is the most important part, especially for syncing my music on other devices with my TV.  It only works consistently with music I've bought through Amazon.  Prime Music has tons of great content, but I can't access it on Fire TV in a useful way.3. Accessing other content providers can be difficult due to the layout of the Apps tab being so far away.4. Now, they do ads for Amazon Studios content.  They're rare but they intrude on my paying for this device and a membership already, I shouldn't have any ads at this point.
author: Sam L.
